revised_title: The Influence of Tube Inclination and Pressure-Dependent Viscosity on the Motion of a Sphere in a Liquid-Filled Tube
tldr: This article investigates the motion of a sphere descending in a liquid-filled tube, considering the effects of tube inclination and pressure-dependent viscosity. The modified lubrication theory predicts a definite side force on the sphere, leading to a lateral displacement. The eccentric position of descent, velocity of descent, and rotation direction are consistent with experimental observations.
